page.title: 13RELIGION IN THE REGION
page.content: THERE IS A DIVERSITY OF RELIGIOUS BELIEF IN THE REGION, WITH A HISTORY OF DISSENTION. IN THE 16TH CENTURY 4 LOCAL PEOPLE WERE MARTYRED AS HERETICS FOR THEIR FAITH. THE MAIN RELIGIONS REPRESENTED ARE CHURCH OF ENGLAND, ROMAN CATHOLIC, AND METHODIST, THE FIRST AND THE LAST HAVING PARTICULARLY STRONG LOCAL TIES. NOT ALL VILLAGES NOW HAVE A CHURCH OF SOME KIND BUT ANGLICAN CHURCHES CAN BE FOUND IN GREAT BENTLEY AND THORRINGTON WITH A METHODIST CHURCH IN GREAT BENTLEY. ROMAN CATHOLIC SERVICES ARE HELD WEEKLY IN THE ANGLICAN CHURCH BY ARRANGEMENT WITH THE CLERGY. ALL MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL CLERGY PLAY AN EXTREMELY IMPORTANT PART IN LOCAL AFFAIRS. THE CHURCH SERVICES ARE WELL ATTENDED BY YOUNG AND OLD, WITH MANY FAMMILIES REPRESENTED.SUNDAY SCHOOL PLAYS AN IMPORTANT PART.
